indications:
Indications tuberculosis, in combination with other drugs; adjunct to doxycycline in brucellosis; enterococcal endocarditis (Table
1, section 5.1)
name: STREPTOMYCIN
cautions: Cautions see under Aminoglycosides, section 5.1.4; interactions: Appendix 1 (aminoglycosides)
side-effects:
Side-effects see under Aminoglycosides, section 5.1.4; also
hypersensitivity reactions, paraesthesia of mouth
doses:
By deep intramuscular injection,
tuberculosis  [unlicensed], 15 mg/kg (max. 1 g) daily (reduced in
those under 50 kg, those over 40 years, or those with renal impairment)

Side-effects increase after
a cumulative dose of 100 g, which should only be exceeded in exceptional
circumstances

One-hour (‘peak’) concentration should be
15–40 mg/litre; pre-dose (‘trough’) concentration should be less than
5 mg/litre (less than 1 mg/litre in renal impairment or in those over
50 years)
